intro: Costus barbatus, commonly known as the hairy costus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric, and is characterized by its ornamental leaves and striking inflorescences. The plant features long, narrow leaves with a hairy texture and produces clusters of fragrant, yellowish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and is often cultivated for its aesthetic value in gardens. Costus barbatus is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
